{"step_by_step_thinking": "Basal cell carcinoma is a type of skin cancer that arises from the basal cells, which are found at the bottom of the epidermis. Keratin pearls are characteristic of squamous cell carcinoma, not basal cell carcinoma. Foam cells are a type of macrophage and are not specific to any type of cancer. Psammoma bodies are typically found in certain types of tumors like meningiomas, papillary thyroid cancer, or serous papillary ovarian carcinoma. Nuclear palisading, which is the arrangement of cells in a row with their nuclei lined up along one side, is a characteristic feature of basal cell carcinoma.", "answer_choice": "C"}
